paper_abstract: A message authentication code (MAC) computes for each (arbitrarily long) message and key a short authentication tag which is hard to forge when is unknown. One of the most popular ways to process in such a scheme is to use some variant of AES in CBC mode, and to derive the tag from the final ciphertext block. In this paper, we analyze the security of several proposals of this type, and show that they are vulnerable to a new type of attack which we call almost universal forgery, in which it is easy to generate the correct tag of any given message if the attacker is allowed to change a single block in it.
paper_title: Almost universal forgery attacks on AES-based MAC's
